title: Lowest Personal Remittances Received
description: In 2023, Brunei received personal remittances amounting to only 0.006% of its GDP, one of the lowest percentages globally.

title: Minimal Use of Alternative and Nuclear Energy
description: As of 2022, alternative and nuclear energy constituted just 0.01% of Brunei's total energy use, indicating minimal reliance on these energy sources.

title: High Domestic Freshwater Withdrawals
description: In 2021, domestic use accounted for 164.67% of Brunei's total freshwater withdrawals, a remarkably high proportion.

title: Low Industrial Design Applications
description: Brunei had only 1 resident industrial design application in 2017, one of the lowest counts globally.

title: High Net National Savings
description: In 2021, Brunei's net national savings were 38.38% of its GNI, one of the highest rates in the world.

title: Low Current Health Expenditure
description: Brunei's current health expenditure was 1.82% of GDP in 2022, among the lowest globally.

title: High Government Health Expenditure
description: In 2022, 92.34% of Brunei's current health expenditure was funded by the government, one of the highest proportions worldwide.

title: Low Tariff Rates on Manufactured Products
description: In 2022, Brunei applied a simple mean tariff rate of 0.19% on manufactured products, one of the lowest globally.

title: High Fuel Imports
description: Fuel imports made up 63.76% of Brunei's merchandise imports in 2023, a significantly high percentage.
